{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.07636v1", "title": "Rational concordance of double twist knots", "summary": "Double twist knots $K_{m, n}$ are known to be rationally slice if $mn = 0$,
$n = -m\pm 1$, or $n = -m$. In this paper, we prove the converse. It is done by
showing that infinitely many prime power-fold cyclic branched covers of the
other cases do not bound a rational ball. Our rational ball obstruction is
based on Donaldson's diagonalization theorem.", "main_category": "math.GT", "categories": "math.GT", "published": "2025-04-10T10:32:28Z"}
